title: Fantasy sports bettor takes on FanDuel after losing everything
description: Amit Patel lost millions betting on daily fantasy sports and is now serving time in prison for stealing from his employer, the Jacksonville Jaguars, to fund his gambling addiction. CNN’s Nick Watt talks to Amit from a federal prison camp in Montgomery, Alabama. Watch “Sports Betting: America’s Big Gamble” on “The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper,” Sunday August 24th for a special showing at 10pm.

Fantasy sports bettor takes on FanDuel after losing everything Amit Patel lost millions betting on daily fantasy sports and is now serving time in prison for stealing from his employer, the Jacksonville Jaguars, to fund his gambling addiction. CNN’s Nick Watt talks to Amit from a federal prison camp in Montgomery, Alabama. Watch “Sports Betting: America’s Big Gamble” on "The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper," Sunday August 24th for a special showing at 10pm. Fantasy sports bettor takes on FanDuel after losing everything

See how a whole church was moved across a city in Sweden Completed in 1912, the Kiruna Church has previously been named Sweden’s most beautiful building. Today, it’s part of a project which will see nearly 6,000 residents and a third of Kiruna’s buildings relocated over the next two decades. See how a whole church was moved across a city in Sweden

Spectral bats form 'cuddle balls' and like to hug A new study found the world's largest carnivorous bat is more social than previously thought. Commonly known as greater false vampire bats, this rare species was observed hunting and playing together and even appeared to hug family members as a form of greeting. Spectral bats form 'cuddle balls' and like to hug

Panic in Milan airport as man sets fire to check-in desk A 28-year-old man was arrested on Wednesday after setting fire to a check in counter at Milan’s Malpensa Airport, causing significant damage and injuring at least one person, police say. The man was tackled by airport police, and is facing charges of aggravated damage to public property. Panic in Milan airport as man sets fire to check-in desk

Fugitive Thomas Callam Phillips vanished into the remote forests of New Zealand’s North Island in 2021 with his three children—now 12-, 10-, and 9-years-old— sparking a four-year search that has gripped the country. Now, after years of silence, his family is making a heartfelt public appeal: they miss him and their grandchildren—and they’re urging him to come home.

‘The Nicest Judge in the World’ dies at 88 Judge Frank Caprio has died at the age of 88 after a battle with pancreatic cancer, according to a post on his Instagram page. Caprio is known for starring on the reality TV series "Caught in Providence" and for spreading kindness on social media. ‘The Nicest Judge in the World’ dies at 88

Born with multiple heart defects, 11-year-old Ava has undergone four open heart surgeries by the age of 5. Video captured the moment she told her father she had been matched with a donor for a full transplant, and her return home from surgery.

Giant panda twins Jia Jia and De De celebrated their first birthdays in Hong Kong on Friday. The cubs were born last August to Ying Ying, who became the oldest giant panda on record to give birth.

University of Nebraska freshman punter, Archie Wilson, left his home in Australia to play for the Cornhuskers. During a press conference, a reporter asked Wilson how he was doing being so far away from his family and his emotional reaction sparked a conversation around masculinity. Writer and philosopher Ryan Holiday joined CNN's Boris Sanchez to discuss.
